content: skill level easy techniques used cast on knit purl bind-off this cozy neck warmer is a one-skein project thoughtfully designed to use up the entire ball of yarn with no leftovers it s an efficient satisfying knit that s perfect for highlighting a favorite skein or making the most of your stash the pattern is easily adapted for scrap yarn by working simple stripes making it a great option for leftover yardage the alpaca creates a warm flexible fabric that sits comfortably around the neck without bulk ideal for layering under coats and jackets for a warmer and denser fabric you can substitute a heavier yarn such as dk or worsted weight while keeping the same needle size this versatility makes the pattern suitable for a wide range of climates and activities perfect for walks bike rides skiing and everyday cold-weather wear **details** * one-skein project no leftovers * scrap-friendly works well in stripes * adjustable warmth by changing yarn weight lightweight warm and comfortable * suitable for active outdoor use **sizes** women s men s = w m the women s size is slightly narrower the men s size is slightly wider around the neck the size is very customizable make it longer or connect the cast-on and bind-off to make it double-layered **yarn** 1 skein filcolana vilja previously known as indiecita 100% alpaca 50 grams = 165 cm **alternatives** sandnes garn alpakka silke isager alpaca 2 drops - alpaca **gauge** 24 sts = 10 cm x 10 cm after blocking needle size is only a guide if you get too many stitches on 10 cm change to a larger needle size if you get too few stitches on 10 cm change to a smaller needle size **materials** 3 0 mm circular needles length does not matter as the magic loop method is used
